page.title: 13Warton Oddities
page.content: Miss Mabel Barton, daughter of a local 19th. century worthy, used to ride her horse up the crag with her two dogs. She loved the crag so much that she asked to be buried there with her animals which were duly shot on her death. It is said that her ghost haunts the crag along with horse and dogs. The family home, now an hotel, is also said to be haunted by an unknown ghost. A stone monolith in the new school field was possibly a pointer to Yealand henge in ancient times. The pointer was knocked off by a builder in 1970. In 1980 the Deputy Head wrote a play about it around a girl called Hannah who was turned to stone. Children now call it the Hannah Stone and so was born a new legend. In 1985 a small USA flag was stolen from a Washington display in church.
